panel1.description: Photorealistic modern tech office, open floor plan. MARCUS THOMPSON (mid-30s, Black male, well-groomed, enthusiastic in crisp button-down) at his sales desk, confidently pasting customer information into ChatGPT on his large monitor. The screen clearly shows: 'Customer: John Smith, SSN: 452-XX-XXXX, Email: john@...' ChatGPT suddenly displays an error message. Marcus looks mildly confused.
panel1.dialogue: Marcus (thought bubble): 'Huh. AI hates Mondays too.'
panel1.hiddenElements: Wall calendar clearly shows 'THURSDAY'. Clock on wall shows exactly 9:47 AM. On a far desk, barely visible, a small purple logo glows on a monitor.

panel2.description: Same office, different angle. ALEX CHEN (early 30s, Asian-American, wearing gray hoodie, round glasses, neutral expression, messy hair) and JORDAN MARTINEZ (late 20s, Latinx woman, button-down slightly untucked, multiple monitors showing dashboards with scrolling data) sit at adjacent desks. They exchange a knowing look without speaking. Alex has a coffee mug that's clearly full but untouched. Jordan's fingers hover over her keyboard.
panel2.hiddenElements: Jordan's main monitor shows 'GATEWAY STATUS: ACTIVE' in small text. Alex's secondary monitor shows scrolling logs with 'PII_BLOCKED' entries. The same 9:47 timestamp appears on their screen corners.

panel3.description: Wide shot of the office. Marcus has shrugged and moved on to his next task, phone to ear, charming a customer. In the background, Alex sips his cold coffee (grimaces slightly at the temperature) while Jordan resumes typing rapidly. The office looks completely normal - other employees working, laughing, collaborating. But Alex and Jordan seem slightly apart from it all.
panel3.hiddenElements: The wall calendar still shows Thursday. Every visible clock shows 9:47. In the very corner of the panel, a motivational poster reads 'PROTECT WHAT MATTERS' with a subtle shield icon.

panel3.description: The developer has given up on pasting the full code, now typing manually instead. He looks annoyed but continues working. panel3.dialogue:
Developer (muttering): 'Guess I'll do it the hard way.'
Alex (barely audible, small text): 'The safe way.'
panel3.hiddenElements: Developer's screen now shows code WITHOUT credentials. The clock still reads 9:47. A small 'Gateway' icon pulses green in Jordan's system tray.

panel1.description: Sales floor celebration. MARCUS stands triumphant, phone in hand, colleagues congratulating him. Visible on his large monitor behind him: ChatGPT with a pasted contract showing 'Acme Corp - $2.5M - Contact: CEO John Smith - Terms: 30% upfront, payment schedule...' MIKE RODRIGUEZ (Sales Director, late 30s, high-energy, sleeves rolled up) slaps Marcus's back.
panel1.dialogue:
Mike: 'How'd you draft that closing email so fast?'
Marcus: 'AI is amazing when you know how to prompt it.'
panel1.hiddenElements: The ChatGPT screen shows an error state - the paste didn't actually work. Marcus didn't notice because he got distracted by the celebration.

panel2.description: Cut to Jordan's desk. Her screen shows an urgent alert cascade: 'CONTRACT_BLOCKED - Source: Sales-Marcus - PII_COUNT: 127 - FINANCIAL_DATA: DETECTED - CLIENT_CONFIDENTIAL: BLOCKED'. She dismisses each alert rapidly, expression unchanging. Alex has stopped mid-sip of his cold coffee, watching the alerts scroll.
panel2.hiddenElements: The PII list scrolls: 'CEO_NAME', 'BANK_DETAILS', 'PRICING_TERMS', 'INTERNAL_MARGIN'... Alex's coffee has clearly been sitting there untouched; there's a coffee ring stain on a paper beneath it.

panel3.description: Wide shot: Marcus celebrating in foreground, accepting congratulations. Deep in background, barely visible, Alex and Jordan at their desks - Jordan still typing, Alex staring at his cold coffee. The celebration continues around them. They are islands of stillness in the chaos.
panel3.dialogue:
Marcus (distant): 'Couldn't have done it without AI!'
Alex (small text, to Jordan): 'Couldn't have done it WITH AI either.'
panel3.hiddenElements: Clock: 9:47. Calendar: Thursday. Jordan's block count now reads: 12,974 TOTAL. A tiny '127' appears in red, fading.

Jordan (not looking up): 'Of what?'
Alex: 'Safety.'

panel1.description: Small conference room. Rachel presents to a leadership team including David. Her slides show: 'AI SECURITY RISKS: 1. PII Leakage 2. Credential Exposure 3. IP Theft 4. Compliance Violations'. She looks serious, pointing at each risk. David nods thoughtfully.
panel1.dialogue: Rachel: 'These threats are REAL. We need to implement controls BEFORE—'
panel1.hiddenElements: Through the glass wall of the conference room, we can see Alex at his desk. His monitor shows the same list - but each item has a green checkmark and 'MITIGATED' status.

panel2.description: Rachel's slide shows 'PROPOSED TIMELINE: 6-month implementation'. She's explaining the complexity. David looks concerned about the timeline. Other leaders are taking notes. Meanwhile, visible through the glass: Jordan's dashboard shows CURRENT status - all threats listed are showing 'ACTIVE PROTECTION' in green.
panel2.dialogue:

David: 'Six months? Can we move faster?'
panel2.hiddenElements: Jordan's screen shows: 'THREAT_COVERAGE: 100%' and 'ACTIVE_SINCE: 1,127 days'. She's not even watching the meeting; she's handling an alert.

panel3.description: Meeting ends. Rachel walks out looking stressed, tablet clutched to chest. She passes Alex's desk, doesn't stop. Alex watches her go, expression unreadable. His monitor still shows the 'MITIGATED' list. Jordan catches his eye, raises an eyebrow fractionally.
panel3.dialogue:
Jordan (quiet): 'Should we tell her?'
Alex (equally quiet): 'Tell her what? That the problems she's worried about were solved before she worried about them?'
Jordan: 'Good thinking.'

#Internship #Tech #MentorMoments #Thursday

panel1.description: Engineering area. A NEW INTERN (college-age, enthusiastic, laptop covered in stickers) approaches Alex's desk with a confused expression. Their laptop shows a failed paste attempt into an AI coding assistant. The paste contained what looks like database credentials. Alex looks up from his monitor, coffee in hand.
panel1.dialogue: Intern: 'Hey, um, Alex? Can you help? I'm trying to use AI to help debug but it won't let me paste my code.'
panel1.hiddenElements: Alex's screen shows a fresh alert: 'DB_CREDENTIALS_BLOCKED - Intern_Workstation'. He minimizes it before turning to face the intern.

panel2.description: Alex stands, walks to intern's desk (coffee comes with him). He looks at their screen without touching anything. The failed paste is visible - 'CONNECTION_STRING=postgresql://admin:supersecret@prod-db...' The AI shows an error. Alex's expression remains completely neutral.
panel2.dialogue:
Alex: 'What are you trying to paste?'
Intern: 'Just my code. To ask about the bug.'
Alex: 'What's IN the code?'
Intern (confused): 'Just... config stuff?'
panel2.hiddenElements: Jordan watches from her desk, fingers paused over keyboard. Her screen shows the intern's blocked attempt in real-time. She's ready to intervene if needed.

panel3.description: Alex gently points at a specific line on the intern's screen - the database password. The intern's eyes go wide with realization. Alex doesn't lecture, doesn't explain, just points. Then he walks back to his desk, sipping his cold coffee.
panel3.dialogue:
Alex (walking away): 'Be careful what you paste. Anything real.'
Intern (calling after, embarrassed): 'Thanks!'
Alex (already back at desk): 'Huh.'
panel3.hiddenElements: The intern's next paste attempt is clean - no credentials. Alex's 'Huh.' is his signature. Jordan adds a note: 'INTERN_LEARNING: TRUE'. Clock: 9:47. Thursday.

panel1.description: Open office. Someone (FRUSTRATED EMPLOYEE - could be anyone, generic professional) stands at their desk, clicking angrily. They've tried to paste sensitive data multiple times. Each attempt fails. Coworkers are starting to notice the frustration. The employee's screen shows repeated error messages from AI tools.
panel1.hiddenElements: In background: multiple employees are watching. Alex has set down his coffee. Jordan has stopped typing for the first time in 14 episodes.

panel2.description: Everyone is looking at the frustrated employee, then at each other, confused. But one by one, eyes drift to Alex and Jordan's corner of the office. The engineers are standing now - the first time they've both stood for something social. Their screens behind them show scrolling data - logs, dashboards, block counts. The Gateway interface is finally visible to others.
panel2.dialogue:
Frustrated Employee: 'Does anyone know why AI never works with sensitive data?'
Silence.
Someone else: '...Alex? Jordan?'
panel2.hiddenElements: The Gateway dashboard is fully visible for the first time: 'TOTAL PROTECTED: 2,341,847 ATTEMPTS'. The logo is clear. The block count is massive.

panel3.description: Alex and Jordan stand side by side. Alex sets down his cold coffee. Jordan's hands are still for the first time. They look at the room - at all the people they've been silently protecting. The moment stretches. Then, finally, Alex speaks. Jordan follows.
panel3.dialogue:
Alex (calm, quiet, final): 'Because we won't let it.'
Long pause.
Jordan: 'We never have.'
panel3.hiddenElements: Clock: 9:47. Calendar: Thursday. But now everyone can see it. Everyone can see everything. The Gateway has been running since before Episode 1. The counter shows: 'PROTECTING SINCE: Day 1'.
